=== About Us ===
The mactel-support team is dedicated to providing the best support possible for running Ubuntu on Intel-based Macintosh Hardware. See <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MactelSupportTeam/AboutUs|MactelSupportTeam/AboutUs]]</nowiki>. <<BR>>

{| class="wikitable"
|-
| <style="background-color: #f9eaaf;"><nowiki>[[File:IconUsers.png]]</nowiki><<BR>> If you are a new member of the <nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/group.php?groupid=352|Mactel Support Team ]]</nowiki>, have a look at the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MactelSupportTeam/Welcome|welcome message for team members]]</nowiki>.
|}

=== How to find documentation for your Mac ===
The entry point for running Ubuntu on Intel CPU-based Macintosh Computers is the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MactelSupportTeam/CommunityHelpPages| Mactel Support Team Community Help Page]]</nowiki>.

If you are looking for support on PowerPC-based Macs, try these pages: <<BR>>
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/PowerPCFAQ <<BR>>
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/PowerPCKnownIssues

=== How to create a Mactel wiki ===
==== Overview Documentation Structure ====

<nowiki>[[File:inkscape.png]]</nowiki><<BR>>'''Please have a close look at the overview of the Mactel documentation to get an idea where to place new pages!'''

<nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MactelSupportTeam/DocArchitecture|Overview of the Mactel documentation architecture and related group pages]]</nowiki>

==== Documentation Guidelines ====

Please have a look at our <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/MactelSupportTeam/DocGuidlines|guidelines for writing documentation]]</nowiki>!<<BR>><<BR>>
The guidelines contain a lot of DOs and DONTs. See it as recommendations. <<BR>>
All wikis for running Ubuntu on a Mac reside in the user community pages <<BR>>
and everybody is free to contribute to them. <<BR>><<BR>>
The '''MactelSupportTeam'''  tries to improve the overall comprehensibility of these documents.

==== Creating a new page ====
<nowiki>[[File:IconUsers.png]]</nowiki><<BR>>  '''Please note:'''
A wiki about a certain Mac hardware belongs into the community help pages (help.ubuntu.com), not
into the team wiki pages (wiki.ubuntu.com). <<BR>>
If you like to create such a wiki, do the following steps:<<BR>>
* Right click, open in new tab and login at <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/|help.ubuntu.com/community/]]</nowiki>
* Create a new page: Right click and open in new tab <<BR>> * Adjust the Ubuntu version in the browser URL. Use  only the first word of the version name with a capital letter at the beginning: <<BR>> '''Example''': Mac``Book Air 1,1 and Ubuntu 8.10 (Intrepid Ibex) will be located at <<BR>> <<BR>><nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MacBookAir1-1/Intrepid|help.ubuntu.com/community/MacBookAir1-1/Intrepid]]</nowiki><<BR>><<BR>>
* Choose <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MactelSupportTeam/DocTemplate|MactelSupportTeam/DocTemplate]]</nowiki> as template for your wiki.

Thank you for using the Mactel documentation template!

A generic support forum for both Intel and Power``Pc based Macs can be found here: <<BR>>

For an archive of the forum from 2008 and before, please go here: <<BR>>
<nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/forumdisplay.php?f=211|Pre 4/21/2008 Archive of thee Apple User's Support Forum]]</nowiki>. <<BR>><<BR>>
Since we don't have a mailing list, we use a dedicated thread, to coordinate our activities: <<BR>>
<nowiki>[[http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=969360|Mactel Documentation Planning ]]</nowiki>

=== Similar/almost identical hardware ===

<code>MacBook 1,1</code> - <code>Mac mini 1,1</code> - <code>MacBook Pro 1,1 (different Graphics Card: ATI instead of the Intel)</code> [ ]<<BR>>
<code>MacBook 2,1</code> - <code>Mac mini 2,1</code> - <code>MacBook Pro 2,1 (different Graphics Card: ATI instead of the Intel)</code> [ ]<<BR>>
<code>MacBook 3,1</code> - <code>MacBook Pro 3,1 (different Graphics Card: nVidia instead of the Intel)</code> [x]<<BR>>
<code>MacBook 5,1</code> - <code>MacBook Pro 5,1 (larger nVidia Graphics Card + Firewire, same trackpad)</code> [x]<<BR>>

The <code>MacBook 4,1</code> and <code>MacBook Pro 4,1</code> differ substantially, in spite of the similar names. The Graphics Card, Trackpad and Systems Manager Controller (SMC) are completely different. The <code>MacBook Pro 4,1</code> is more similar to the <code>MacBook Air 1,1</code> (Trackpad, SMC).

=== Hardware/Software/Contributors Working Matrix (Ubuntu 8.10 "Intrepid Ibex") ===
** '''Please sign in''' yourself to the hardware you have access to! 
** Please sign in also the best matching wiki/wikis you found at <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com|wiki.ubuntu.com]]</nowiki> or <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community|help.ubuntu.com/community]]</nowiki> for your hardware. 
** Read it/them.
** Under <code>Status of the wiki</code> please write down what has do be done, to make it as good, as possible. 
** Communicate your wishes/goals/changes to others in the team and in the revision history of the wiki. 
** Link the wiki to this page, so people can join us and see our guidelines.
** Then go for the changes! <<BR>>
